You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Style Your Storefront with a Theme

A B2B Commerce for Visualforce theme packages CSS, JavaScript, and image files in a static resource that you can associate with a storefront. A theme specifies a branded look and feel across your entire storefront, including colors, fonts, company logo, and other visual identity rules. With a theme, you can supplement or override the default Bootstrap styles, or insert a custom JavaScript library. B2B Commerce for Visualforce provides some default themes that you can use as a starting point for making your own custom theme.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set
To create static resources:	Customize Application

B2B Commerce for Visualforce installs the following storefront theme static resources in your org.

CC_Theme_Capricorn
A fully styled override of the default Bootstrap 3 styles with images and colors to complement the Capricorn Coffee demo storefront data. This theme static resource is useful for training, demonstrations, and reference.
CC_Theme_Minimum
A starter theme using only the default Bootstrap 3 styles. This theme static resource is a good starting point for developing your own theme.
CC_Theme_Capricorn_Classic
A full styled override of the default Bootstrap 2 styles with images and colors to complement the Capricorn Coffee demo storefront data.
TIP Salesforce recommends that all new B2B Commerce for Visualforce implementations use the Bootstrap 3 framework if possible. Some B2B Commerce for Visualforce features are compatible only with Bootstrap 3, and upgrading to new versions of B2B Commerce is simpler.

B2B Commerce for Visualforce requires a specific folder structure for a theme's static resource.

Working Directory (1)
The directory that contains the folders to compress into a ZIP file for uploading as a static resource.
NOTE Ensure that the word Theme is part of the ZIP file name when you compress the contents of the working directory. CC Admin looks for static resources with this keyword to populate the list of available themes in storefront settings.
Bootstrap 3 CSS (2)
Style sheets for a Bootstrap 3-enabled theme. Use the styles.css file to specify your custom styles to supplement or override the default Bootstrap 3 styles.
TIP You can have more CSS files in this folder, but the default Bootstrap 3 Handlebar templates reference only styles.css. For each additional CSS file, create a CSS 3 Include storefront configuration setting with the relative path to the file within the static resource, such as css3/styles.css. For help with setting these configurations, see step 6. These settings ensure that B2B Commerce for Visualforce creates references to all your CSS files in the page source.
NOTE A theme for a storefront that uses the Bootstrap 2 Handlebar templates—known as the classic interface—has a folder named css instead of css3.
Fonts (3)
Embedded font files that your CSS references, such as EOT, SVG, TTF, and WOFF files.
Images (4)
Image files that your CSS references.
JavaScript (5)
Local JavaScript libraries you want to reference from your theme. By default, this folder includes a theme-specific override of the default uiproperties.js file, which is installed with the CC_JavaScript_Framework static resource. The default uiproperties.js defines handlebars.js templates and partials, HTML selectors, and some default properties for components on storefront pages.

Follow these steps to download the CC_Theme_Minimum resource, use it to create your own storefront theme, and then load it into your org.

Download the CC_Theme_Minimum static resource.
From Setup, enter Static Resources in the Quick Find box, and then select Static Resources.
To filter the list of static resources, click C, and then click CC_Theme_Minimum.
In the static resource detail, click View file to download it to your local system.
Open the downloaded ZIP folder and copy the contents to a safe working directory on your local system. Rename the root folder to something unique.
In your working directory, create your theme files using the required folder structure.
Compress the contents of your working directory into a ZIP file.
NOTE
Make sure that you compress the contents of your working directory, not the working directory itself.
Ensure that the word Theme is part of the ZIP file name when you compress the contents of the working directory. CC Admin looks for static resources with this keyword to populate the list of available themes in storefront settings.
Upload the ZIP file to your org’s static resources.
From Setup, enter Static Resources in the Quick Find box, and then select Static Resources.
Click New, complete the following fields for the static resource, and save.
FIELD	VALUE
Name	Enter a meaningful name for the static resource.
File	Enter the ZIP file you created.
Cache Control	Select Public.
Register the static resource that you uploaded in your storefront configuration settings.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select Theme (3).
Find the Name configuration (4), and click the current static resource name currently shown for Value (5).
Enter the name of the static resource that you uploaded, and click the blue checkmark  to accept.
Register any custom CSS files you added in your theme.
From the Module picklist, select CSS 3 Includes (7).
Click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	CSS 3 Includes
Configuration	CSS 3 Include n, where n is the lowest number that’s not already in use
Page	all
Value	The relative path to the file within the static resource, such as css3/custom_styles.css
Enable the theme you uploaded.
In the Storefront Settings menu, scroll to the Appearance section, and select Themes (8).
Find the theme you uploaded, and click Enable (9).
Build and activate a new configuration cache.
Default JavaScript Libraries for Storefront Pages
By default, B2B Commerce for Visualforce references several open-source JavaScript libraries for rendering components and implementing component behavior on storefront pages. The managed package distributes specific versions of these libraries, depending on the version of the package you've installed.
Exclude the Standard CSS and JavaScript Libraries
As part of customizing the storefront user experience, you can optionally exclude all the default third-party CSS and JavaScript libraries that the managed package distributes. These references are omitted from <head> element in your rendered storefront pages.
SEE ALSO
Show a Unique Storefront Theme for an Account Group
(Salesforce Developers) ccrz.uiProperties
